main event: One oval, bright yellow object the size of a nickel was seen moving up, down, and sideways in Columbia, S.C. on March 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for about 5 to 7 minutes., The object changed direction erratically., The sighting was made by a single observer standing in their backyard., The object was described as having a bright yellow color., The sight occurred on a clear night with minimal cloud coverage.
witness description: one person standing in their backyard
